body: But the problem is I don't think there's a way to retrieve the original value from a hash ID.
Yes, from Spring `3.x or 4.x` you need to exclude `spring-context` instead of `spring`.
Does the provider url appear in the Registry?

https://github.com/apache/incubator-dubbo/tree/3.x-dev/dubbo-rpc/dubbo-rpc-rsocket

I think you need a Stream pipeline between the Client and the Server. This feature in 3.0.0 may meet your requirement.
Please see the comments I left on your pull request.
LGTM. Have you tested it?
请问你参考的是哪篇说明文档？

1、源码中README.md中只提供了2.7版本的maven依赖。
2、http://dubbo.incubator.apache.org/zh-cn/docs/user/dependencies.html中描述的依赖关系也是比较旧的，像添加curator-framework以及com.alibaba.spring.spring-context-support也没做说明
@beiwei30 yes, already tested it.

> Does the provider url appear in the Registry?

Yes, request by browser is correct!you can try it.
dup of https://github.com/apache/incubator-dubbo/issues/3242.

Dear @chickenlj, Thanks you for your exciting information.
After quickly checking the branch, I have several questions:
1. Do you have a short documentation about Dubbo 3.x? We just wonder if this new release it an API breaker with major difference compared to 2.7 APIs or not.
2. Do you have any documentation regarding this new protocol? Or they are not available yet?
3. For Stream pipeline, AFAIU the serialization of the stream is handle by the protocol. Is that right?
4. Do you know when will be the expectation of the the 3.x Dubbo release?

Followed by the previous issue,  if we configure `dataId=dubbo-config-org.apache.dubbo.demo.DemoService.configurators` and `group=dubbo`, Dubbo still can not retrieve the configuration value during start up, listeners to the update works well.

The reason is in `org.apache.dubbo.registry.integration.AbstractConfiguratorListener#initWith`, there is a call to get config directly:

```
String rawConfig = dynamicConfiguration.getConfig(key);
```

However, since no group is passed, the `DEFAULT_GROUP` will be used in Nacos, therefore the config value could not be retrieved.

Since in service governance configuration, Dubbo will always use "dubbo" as group. What I did is apply the following change to `AbstractConfiguratorListener`

```
-        String rawConfig = dynamicConfiguration.getConfig(key);
+        String rawConfig = dynamicConfiguration.getConfig(key, Constants.DUBBO);
```

then everything will work fine.
